task_summary: Perceive the T-shaped block and the goal outline, align the circular end-effector, push the block toward the target along a NW direction, fine-align at the slot, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop pushing task is executed by a robot with a circular end-effector. The scene contains a T-shaped block and a drawn T-shaped goal outline. The robot first ensures both the block and the goal are visible, then approaches above the block, aligns its TCP yaw, and performs a primary push toward the goal. Near the goal, it performs a fine alignment and, if not yet correctly placed, issues a short corrective push before verifying placement and retreating. Timeouts are moderate to accommodate accurate alignment; tolerances are tight for precise placement.
preconditions: Robot and camera initialized at 10Hz observation/control.
Workspace clear; block and goal on the plane.
stepwise_plan: Ensure visibility of block_T and target_slot (scan if needed).
Move above and align to the block with tight tolerance.
Set TCP yaw for diagonal push.
Execute primary push toward the goal.
Fine-align to the target outline; if not at goal, perform a small corrective push.
Verify placement and retreat from the workspace.
success_criteria: Block pose overlaps the target outline within visual tolerance.
No loss of contact that causes large deviation.
Robot retreats to a safe distance.
failure_and_recovery: Over-shoot or misalignment: re-align to target and nudge again.
Unexpected contact: time out and retreat.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when IsAt(target_slot) succeeds and the robot has executed Retreat.

frame_3.now_evidence: Primary push starts with clear contact and direction visible.
frame_3.predicts_next: Approach to target outline and fine alignment expected.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Checks visibility of the T block.
Line scan to relocate the block.
Checks visibility of the goal outline.
Line scan to relocate the goal.
Hover above the block before contact.
Yaw alignment for diagonal push path.
Fine alignment near the goal outline.
Checks whether the block is at the goal.
Short corrective nudge if not yet at goal.
Back away to a safe pose.

failure_modes: Block not detected due to lighting/occlusion
Push distance insufficient to reach goal
recovery_strategy: Fallback scans for both block and goal
Re-align TCP yaw then retry push
Issue corrective short push and re-check
Timeout and retreat on abnormal contact
assumptions: Frames show a red T block and a blue goal outline; instruction mentions gray block and green target. We follow the frames.
Push direction set to 135Â° (north-west) based on block/goal geometry in frames.
No grasping is required; contact pushing only.

expected_success_criteria: IsAt(target_slot) becomes true after push/fine alignment
Final block pose visually overlaps the outline
Robot retreats cleanly without disturbing placement
